name: Taj Mahal
description: A white marble mausoleum built in memory of the Mughal emperor Shah Jahan's wife Mumtaz Mahal.

name: Great Wall of China
description: A series of fortifications stretching across northern China, built to protect the Chinese Empire from invasions.

name: Colosseum
description: An ancient Roman amphitheater built of concrete and stone, used for gladiatorial contests and public spectacles.

name: Machu Picchu
description: An ancient Incan city perched high in the Andes Mountains, known for its intricate stonework and stunning views.

name: Chichen Itza
description: A major Mayan city known for its impressive pyramid structures, including the Temple of Kukulkan.

name: Angkor Wat
description: A massive temple complex built by the Khmer Empire, considered one of the world's most impressive architectural achievements.

name: Petra
description: An ancient Nabatean city carved into the sandstone cliffs of a narrow gorge, known for its intricate architecture and dramatic setting.

name: Great Pyramid of Giza
description: The largest of the three pyramids at Giza, a monumental tomb built for the Egyptian pharaoh Khufu.

name: Parthenon
description: An ancient Greek temple dedicated to the goddess Athena, considered a masterpiece of classical architecture.

name: Forbidden City
description: A vast imperial palace complex that served as the home of Chinese emperors for centuries.

name: Eiffel Tower
description: An iconic wrought-iron lattice tower on the Champ de Mars, one of the most recognizable landmarks in the world.

name: Statue of Liberty
location: Liberty Island, New York City, USA
description: A colossal copper statue representing liberty and enlightenment, a gift from France to the United States.

name: Stonehenge
description: A prehistoric monument consisting of a ring of standing stones, believed to have been used for astronomical purposes.

name: Great Mosque of Djenn√©
description: A mudbrick mosque considered one of the largest earthen buildings in the world.

name: Christ the Redeemer
description: A large Art Deco statue of Jesus Christ overlooking the city of Rio de Janeiro.

name: Pompeii
description: An ancient Roman city preserved under layers of ash and pumice after the eruption of Mount Vesuvius.

name: Easter Island
description: A remote island known for its iconic moai statues, believed to have been created by the Rapa Nui people.

name: Great Barrier Reef
description: The world's largest coral reef system, home to a diverse array of marine life.

name: Hagia Sophia
description: A former Greek Orthodox cathedral, later converted into a mosque, and now a museum, known for its impressive dome and mosaics.

name: Angkor Thom
description: A walled city within the Angkor Archaeological Park, known for its impressive temples and bas-relief carvings.
